snippet: Violent rap lyrics should not have been introduced as evidence in Vonte Skinner’s trial on an attempted murder charge, the state’s highest court said.
abstract: New Jersey Supreme Court rules that violent rap lyrics should not have been introduced as evidence in attempted murder trial of Vonte Skinner; defendant has been convicted of 2005 shooting of Lamont Peterson, who was paralyzed from incident; ruling upholds lower court decision and orders new trial.
lead_paragraph: Violent rap lyrics should not have been introduced as evidence in Vonte Skinner’s trial on an attempted murder charge, the state’s highest court said.

headline.main: New Jersey High Court Rules Lyrics Inadmissible in Rapper’s Case
headline.print_headline: New Jersey High Court Rules Lyrics Inadmissible in Rapper’s Case
